intro: Veronica persica var. corrensiana, commonly known as the Persian speedwell, is a flowering plant native to regions of southern Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its low-growing habit, with small, blue or violet flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and is often found in rocky or gravelly soils. It is a member of the Plantaginaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with similar ecological preferences. This variety is notable for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in harsh environments.
